title: Modular anomaly of BPS back holes
abstract:
Generating functions of BPS indices, counting states of D4-D2-D0 black holes
in Calabi-Yau compactifications of type IIA string theory and identified with
rank 0 Donaldson- Thomas invariants, are examples of mock modular forms. They
have a quite complicated modular anomaly expressed as a sum over three
different types of trees weighted by generalized error functions and their
derivatives. We show that this anomaly can be significantly simplified, which
in turn simplfies finding the corresponding mock modular generating functions.
